message.content:
cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.EC, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with the problem of designing optimal auctions, which is a classic topic in algorithmic game theory (cs.GT) and computational social choice (cs.DS). The focus is on restricted allocations, which can be seen as a form of preference elicitation, a common theme in artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also uses mathematical programming techniques to prove a strong duality result, which is a common tool in optimization theory (cs.IT). Overall, the paper seems to fit well within the intersection of these subfields.
